item.name: Current Settings
item.tooltip: The settings currently being used. Either defined when the system was created, by a previous invokation of this dialog, or by directly editing system.mhs.

item.name: Minimum Area
item.tooltip: The smallest possible MicroBlaze core. No caches or debug.

item.name: Maximum Performance
item.tooltip: Maximum performance. Large caches and debug, as well as all execution units.

item.name: Maximum Frequency
item.tooltip: Maximum frequency. No caches or debug, with few execution units.

item.name: Linux with MMU
item.tooltip: Settings suitable to get high performance when running Linux with MMU. Memory Management enabled, large caches and debug, as well as all execution units.

item.name: Low-end Linux with MMU
item.tooltip: Settings corresponding to the Embedded Reference System, used in the SP605 Embedded Kit. It provides settings for Linux development on low-end systems. Memory Managment enabled, small caches and debug.

item.name: Typical
item.tooltip: Settings giving a reasonable compromise between performance, area and frequency. Suitable for standalone programs, and low-overhead kernels. Caches and debug enabled.
